The 6 Best Blenders To Make Soups, Smoothies, Nut Butters And More

ByFran Sales,

Updates Writer.

I've been researching and testing lifestyle products for over 5 years.

Reviewed ByAmanda Arnold,

Sr. Home & Kitchen Editor.

Mar 10, 2025, 03:54pm EDT

Capable of blitzing everything from frozen berries to nuts to cooked vegetables with ease, the best blenders are powerful, versatile and built to last. Based on rigorous research and testing, our top recommendation is the Vitamix 5200, a mighty, tried-and-true model designed to stand up to years of regular use. For occasional users or budget-minded shoppers, we also like the straightforward Hamilton Beach Power Elite, thanks to its under-$50 price tag, sturdy construction and reliable performance.

To determine the very best blenders, we considered factors including performance, ease of use, noise level, footprint, price and additional features. Whether you’re a novice cook or a seasoned chef who’s looking to make smoothies, nut butters or puréed soups, there’s a blender on this list that can meet your kitchen needs.

Our Top Recommendations

  • Best Blender Overall: Vitamix 5200
  • Best Budget Blender: Hamilton Beach Power Elite Multi-Function Blender
  • Best Upgrade Blender: Vitamix Ascent X4
  • Best Blender-Food Processor Combo: Ninja Foodi Power Blender Ultimate System
  • Best Personal Blender: Nutribullet Pro 900
  • Best Blender For Crushing Ice: KitchenAid K150 3 Speed Ice Crushing Blender

Best Blender Overall

A Powerful, Long-Lasting Workhorse That's Worth The Price

Vitamix 5200

$500

Capacity: 64 ounces | Material: BPA-free plastic | Dimensions: 20.5 x 8.8 x 7.3 inches | Weight: 10.6 pounds | Power: 1,380 watts

Pros:

  • Powerful, quick and consistent performance
  • Can make hot foods
  • Backed by seven-year warranty

Cons:

  • Expensive 
  • Very loud (but you won’t have to run it for a long time, thanks to its power)

If you’re looking for an extremely versatile blender, you can’t go wrong with a Vitamix. Whether you’re making soups, batter, sauces and yes, even the thickest of smoothies, the Vitamix 5200 excels. Its BPA-free plastic container can accommodate 64 ounces of liquid, ideal for large-batch cooking; plus, the laser-cut stainless steel blades and 1,380-watt motor process tricky ingredients like ice and seeds. It can also reach speeds that create friction heat, meaning it’s possible to heat ingredients inside the blender in seconds (six, according to the brand) to make soups.

Aside from the Vitamix 5200’s power and smooth blending, several users rave about how quickly it blends (some say it can make smoothies in under a minute), the smooth consistency of its results and how easy it is to clean. Yes, it is on the expensive side, but we think it’s worth the investment.

What our staffers say: “This Vitamix has operated flawlessly for me,” says Forbes Vetted product manager Matt Flood. “I’ve put it through its paces making smoothies, sauces and nut butters. It has held up well in tough-to-blend situations and it’s always able to produce a mixture without chunks. Based on the weight, feel and output of the blender, I can tell why the Vitamix has a five- to 10-year warranty on its products.”

The 2024 Forbes Vetted Best Product Awards are here: Explore our 150 top-recommended items across categories after extensive research and testing.

Best Budget Blender

A Beginner-Friendly Power Player With 12 Functions

Hamilton Beach Power Elite Multi-Function Blender

$40

Capacity: 40 ounces | Material: Glass | Dimensions: 8.7 x 6.5 x 14.7 inches | Weight: 7.7 pounds | Power: 700 watts

Pros:

  • Easy-to-pour spout
  • Glass jar feels heavy-duty and durable
  • Glass doesn’t hold onto odors after cleaning

Cons:

  • Blends quite loudly
  • Lid can be difficult to remove after blending

If you’re looking for a straightforward, inexpensive blender that won’t take up much space in your kitchen, the Hamilton Beach Power Elite is a great pick. Priced under $50, this blender can handle ice and frozen fruits for smoothies and shakes, or puree rough ingredients for smooth and silky sauces and dressings. It also features a technology that pulls whatever you’re blending down toward the blades for fewer chunks and a smoother mixture.

The 40-ounce jar is made of thermal shock-tested glass and features stainless steel blades that seamlessly blend hard foods. For those who loathe the damage a heavy pour does to their countertops, this blender’s lid features a spout for easy, no-mess pouring. Choose from 12 blender functions, including grind, dice, chop, crush ice and more. Plus, we love that the glass jar is dishwasher-safe, there’s included storage for the power cord and the whole thing is backed by a three-year warranty.

What the reviews say: “This is one of the best I’ve owned," writes an Amazon reviewer. "It’s definitely not a Vitamix, but it powers through my pre-frozen smoothie mixes like a champ! I’ve even used it for making salsa and it only took a few minutes. It comes apart easily for cleaning. I like that the lid has a pour spout that doesn’t leak or spill on everything, and the fact that it’s glass means it’s not getting scratched up.”

Best Upgrade Blender

A Sleek, Premium Model Built To Last 10-Plus Years

Vitamix Ascent X4

$700

Capacity: 48 ounces | Material: BPA-free plastic | Dimensions: 9.8 x 7.8 x 17 inches | Weight: 14.3 pounds | Power: 1,500 watts

Pros:

  • Extremely powerful
  • Intuitive touchscreen interface
  • Backed by 10-year warranty

Cons:

  • Very expensive 
  • Heavy

If you want the gold standard of blenders, this Vitamix model—which belongs to the brand’s new Ascent X Series—is a premium, well-constructed pick. Equipped with a 48-ounce BPA-free plastic container, 1,500-watt motor and five blending presets, this blender can handle pretty much anything you throw at it. 

Operating it is a breeze, as it has a bright and intuitive touch interface and control knob, which you use to cycle through the settings. It also has two especially useful buttons: One starts a self-cleaning program, where you add warm water and a drop of dish soap to the container, and another adds 15 seconds to a blend, which comes in handy when your smoothie or nut butter could use just a little more time. And then attached to the base is a built-in tamper holder, so the included tamper is always accessible. Lastly, as evidenced by its 10-year full warranty, this blender is truly built to last.

What the editors say: “I’ve used this blender to make at least 20 smoothies, as well as homemade ginger shots, which requires the machine’s blades to pulverize pounds of hard, fibrous ginger,” says senior home and kitchen editor Amanda Arnold owns this model. “While it sometimes struggles with drier mixtures like extra-thick smoothies, the display tells you when you should get involved during blender and use the tamper, which usually resolves the issue. Overall, I’ve been really pleased with this Vitamix.”

Best Blender-Food Processor Combo

A High-Powered Timesaver That Also Grates And Shreds

MOST POPULAR

Ninja Foodi Power Blender Ultimate System

Capacity: 72 ounces | Material: Plastic | Dimensions: 8.7 x 8.3 x 16.1 inches | Weight: 12.3 pounds | Power: 1,600 watts

Pros:

  • Saves counter space by eliminating the need for a food processor
  • Powerful 1,600-watt motor easily produces smooth, creamy smoothies
  • Removable parts (including blades) are dishwasher-safe

Cons:

  • Plastic-heavy construction might not stand up to rigorous use long-term
  • Doesn’t do as well with smaller portions

Looking to cut down prep time or reduce the number of appliances cluttering your countertops? The Ninja Foodi Ultimate System is specifically designed to address those needs (in fact, it’s what earned it the top spot on our list of the best blender-food processor combos). This multi-piece kit, which includes a 72-ounce blender pitcher and two other disc blades for various food processing tasks, can tackle many of the kitchen tasks you already do regularly, but a lot more efficiently and consistently.

The blender makes quick work of crushing ice and churning out consistent smoothie bowls thanks to its powerful 1600-watt motor and variable speed control dial. Furthermore, the seven preset programs help take some of the guesswork out of food prep. The system also has a helpful “feed chute,” removable blade assembly and two food processing discs; the first of which can slice and shred, while the second grates. Many reviewers highlight that time-consuming (and sometimes uncomfortable) jobs like slicing potatoes, shredding carrots and grating garlic take only a few seconds with the Ninja.

What the reviews say: “The Power Blender Ultimate System has truly transformed my kitchen experience," says an Amazon reviewer. "Its robust motor effortlessly crushes ice, making the silkiest smoothies, and the variable speed settings allow for precision in all my blending needs. The multi-tiered blade system ensures everything is blended to perfection. I also appreciate the BPA-free pitcher for peace of mind. This blender is a game-changer, and I highly recommend it for its power, versatility and sleek design.”

Best Personal Blender

A Space-Saver Powerful Enough For Protein Shakes And Smoothies

Nutribullet Pro 900

$88.87

Capacity: 32 ounces | Container material: BPA-free plastic | Dimensions: 7.7 x 12 x 15.9 inches | Weight: 4.7 pounds | Power: 900 watts

Pros:

  • Easy to use and control
  • Takes up little counter space
  • Cups are portable and dishwasher safe

Cons:

  • Can only blend smaller batches

The small-but-mighty Nutribullet Pro 900, our current top pick for the best personal blender, can churn everything from smoothies to frozen desserts. The 32-ounce blender relies on a 900-watt motor that crushes ice, blends whole fruits and veggies and pulverizes ingredients. Along with the base, the set comes with two blending cups with to-go lids, two handled lip rings and two cup rings, making this ideal for folks who like to take their smoothies on the go. Adding to its appeal, it takes up little counter and storage space—a plus for those with smaller kitchens. One more nice perk: This blender comes in a handful of colors, if you like your kitchen tools to be bright and cheerful.

What the editors say: Arnold also owns this model, which she’s used almost daily for over four years—and she reports that hers is still as good as new. “This exceedingly popular Nutribullet proves that personal blenders can be just as versatile, efficient and long-lasting as standard blenders,” she says. “While I don’t use it to make super thick mixes like nut butter or hot blends, I find that I reach for this device more than my regular blender, as it takes no time to pull it out of my cabinet, pop it on my counter and get mixing.” 

Best Blender For Crushing Ice

A Vintage-Style Option With Blades Designed To Tackle Ice

KitchenAid K150 3 Speed Ice Crushing Blender

Capacity: 48 ounces | Material: BPA-free plastic | Dimensions: 7.1 x 8.5 x 14.8 inches | Weight: 10 pounds | Power: 650 watts

Pros:

  • Asymmetrical blades designed to maximize ice crushing
  • Intelligent-speed motor control maintains the right speed for pitcher’s contents
  • Very sturdy base

Cons:

  • At 650 watts, not the most powerful motor on this list
  • Lid can be difficult to remove after blending

The KitchenAid K150’s blades are specifically designed for crushing ice. They’re shaped asymmetrically, each bent at several angles, so that when you blend, the ingredients are pulled into the center of the pitcher to maximize the crushing. In fact, the brand says that the K150 is able process half a tray of ice in as quickly as 10 seconds.

Plus, this blender is equipped with KitchenAid’s “Soft Start” feature, which starts the motor gently and slowly ramps to reduce chances of splatter. While the ice-crushing setting is the one most capable of quickly processing ice, there are three other speed settings so you can control the consistency of your final product. Better yet, the blender jar is bottom rack dishwasher-safe.

What the reviews say: “This is a very basic blender that does everything I wanted it to do," writes a Walmart reviewer. "The simplicity of design is perfect—one-touch ice-crushing and three speed choices. The base is a bit bulky and the overall design has a retro vibe. The ice-crushing feature exceeded my expectations: quieter than previous blenders, resulting in finely crushed ice.”

RECOMMENDED BY FORBES VETTED

Labor Day Vitamix Sales: Save Up To 30% On These Popular Blenders

By Fran Sales

The 5 Best Food Processors That Slice, Dice And Pulverize With Ease

By Amanda Arnold

Why Trust Forbes Vetted

The Forbes Vetted home and kitchen editorial team relied on a combination of our staff’s category expertise, in-depth research and hands-on experience from our teammates to guide our process of selecting the best blenders.

  • We consulted professionally trained chef Carla Contreras to help us determine which features are most important in a blender.
  • Lastly, we make sure this story is regularly updated to ensure our recommendations are in stock and that they are still the best blenders on the market. It was last refreshed in March 2025 by Arnold.

How We Chose The Best Blenders

The home and kitchen editorial team used our collective knowledge and expertise on blenders, as well as input from our expert, to determine the best blenders on the market.

  • We focused on top-rated models backed by stellar reviews, tried-and-true household names (like Vitamix and Ninja) and picks that we have personally used and can vouch for.
  • We considered factors like ease of use, performance, noise level, aesthetics, footprint and accessories.
  • We made note of certain tasks each blender excels at handling, including blending smoothies, crushing ice, pulverizing nuts and more.
  • Furthermore, we considered blenders highly recommended by Forbes Vetted staffers.

What To Consider In The Best Blender

When shopping for a blender, start by identifying exactly what you’ll use your blender for and how often; then, narrow down what features you’ll need in a blender for those uses. Below are a few important considerations to start with.

Speed

A reliable blender typically has more than one speed setting to allow for customization. Carla Contreras, a professionally trained chef, food stylist and health coach, says the speed options you choose will ultimately depend on the recipes you’re making. If versatility is your priority, aim for a blender with between three and 10 speed settings to ensure you have proper control of whatever you’re blending, and ideally choose an option that has a pulse button.

Power

If your blender doesn’t have enough power, you’ll feel frustrated every time you go to make something. Basic blenders start out at around 600 to 800 watts of power, which should be enough to make a milkshake or blend a smoothie with fresh fruit. Higher-performance blenders, which have 1,000 watts of power or more, are generally more expensive, but they’re more capable of (and more efficient at) pulverizing ice and foods like nuts to make nut butter. “You will definitely want more power if you want silky smoothies and soups, and especially if you are using frozen or fibrous fruit and veggies,” Contreras says.

Price

If you’re having a hard time deciding on a budget, first consider how often you’ll use your blender (and then, what you’ll want to use it for). A more basic blender can cost under $100, but keep in mind affordable options won’t be as powerful or fast as higher-end ones. If you expect to get daily or weekly use out of your blender, then you may consider investing more. More powerful blenders with advanced features can cost more than $500, but in exchange, you might end up with an appliance you’ll enjoy using for a variety of kitchen tasks, and one that lasts for years to come.

Vitamix, one brand that offers reliably high-powered, feature-packed blenders, backs those gadgets with a five- to 10-year warranty to vouch for their quality. “If your blender is a fixture in your kitchen that you plan to use daily, like mine, then it's definitely something to invest in,” says Contreras. “I have had my professional Vitamix for over 10 years and it never leaves my countertop.”

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

The Vitamix is one of the best brands to go to for blenders. In fact, two of its offerings—the Vitamix 5200 and the Vitamix Ascent X4 made the cut (as best overall and best upgrade blenders, respectively). That said, we stand by all of the brands recommended above, including Nutribullet, KitchenAid and Ninja.

Different chefs have different opinions as to which blender is truly “the best,” but Contreras cites speed as the determining factor. “Personally, I love a high-speed blender,” she offers. “I know on busy mornings that I can toss in frozen chunks of banana or cauliflower rice into my smoothie and have a smooth and creamy beverage, ready in under two minutes without having to add ice,” she says.

It depends on the exact model, but budget blenders typically last three to five years, while higher-end blenders can last 10 or more. Generally speaking, purchasing replacement blades is never a bad idea (and it’s certainly more cost-effective than buying an entirely new device). If you notice any big scratches or an obvious change in blender performance, contact the manufacturer to check whether there’s a replacement available—and remember to cash in on any available warranties.

Under The Radar: How Fly By Jing's Founder Is Turning Chinese Ingredients Into An American Pantry Staple

BySholeen Damarwala

Forbes writers and editors independently select all products and services. If you click through links we provide, we may earn a commission. Learn more
Forbes VettedHomeKitchen & Dining

Under The Radar: How Fly By Jing's Founder Is Turning Chinese Ingredients Into An American Pantry Staple

BySholeen Damarwala

I'm the home and kitchen editor at Forbes Vetted.
Sep 24, 2021, 03:01pm EDT

Under The Radar is our monthly column where we highlight some of the coolest, most inspiring founders of brands in the home and kitchen space.

Although Jing Gao was born in Chengdu, aka the flavor capital of China, she grew up in cities all over Europe before moving to Canada to attend school. A tech job brought her back to Asia (mainly Singapore and China), where she spent the majority of her twenties reconnecting with her roots. “I started digging into the food culture and writing about it,” says Gao. “I was just really struck by this 5,000-year heritage that nobody outside of China [seemed to really know about]

, and just became really interested in rewriting some of those false narratives that existed about Chinese food and bringing to the foreground some incredible aspects of the food culture.”

What started as a passion project eventually led Gao to quit her job, train under legendary Chengdu chef Yu Bo, open a restaurant, launch a series of pop-up restaurants around the world and eventually a signature line of sauces and spices in 2019 after an incredibly successful Kickstarter campaign. To honor Chengdu’s “fly restaurants” (hole-in-the-wall joints that are known for creating dishes that are so flavorful that they’re said to attract people like flies), she named her brand Fly by Jing.

RECOMMENDED BY FORBES VETTED

Cook Like—Brooklyn Chef Calvin Eng

By Amanda Arnold

Elevated Chinese Pantry Staples

While western cuisines like French and Italian are perceived as fine dining in the United States, Asian cuisines are usually equated with fast, cheap meals. With her growing range of high-quality and carefully sourced offerings, Gao is bringing attention to the rich history of Chinese ingredients and food culture. “Hopefully by sharing our story, my journey, the story of the product, we’re helping to create space and encourage others to do the same,” she says.

Sichuan Chili Crisp

$15

Her very first launch was a classic Chili Crisp, but unlike the MSG-loaded options available for a little over $2 at Asian grocery stores, Gao spent years chasing the very best Sichuan suppliers and merchants to source 18 premium ingredients that make up her special sauce. Made in small batches by a women-led startup, Gao ensured that no shortcuts were used to achieve a true umami flavor that you’ll want to drizzle over just about everything—from eggs and rice to tacos and even vanilla ice cream (don’t knock it before you try it!).

Fly By Jing Triple Threat

$42$45Save $3 (7%)

In addition to the intensely flavored (and highly addictive) chili crisp, Gao’s sauce lineup also includes Zhong Sauce (a sweet, tangy and spicy concoction that goes well with grilled meats and soft cheeses) and Mala Spice (a signature Sichuan flavor mix of 11 potent herbs and spices).

Fly By Jing Fire Hot Pot Base

$20

To prove that Fly By Jing is more than just a sauce brand, Gao has recently launched a Fire Hot Pot Base, the first all-natural soup base option available in the west. For anyone new to the joy of digging into a hot pot, all you need to do is stock up on dipping ingredients (noodles, tofu, meat, vegetables...you get the point) to create your very own delicious hot pot to share with friends and family. She also stocks premium pantry staples from local manufacturers like a 10-year aged black vinegar, 3-year-aged doubanjiang and preserved black beans to name a few. “We want to be the go-to source for the highest quality Chinese food in the world,” notes Gao, sharing plans of slowly expanding her product line to include a lot more condiments and pantry staples in the coming months.

Making Chinese Ingredients A Staple In American Cooking

Gao’s secret sauce to success lies in her deep understanding of marketing foreign pantry staples to a largely American audience. In addition to her bold neon branding that just begs to be Instagrammed, the jar and packets themselves have detailed instructions on how to use the items, and the brand’s website also features a wide range of recipes for more ideas. And unlike several Asian pantry staples sold in the U.S. with local branding, Gao chose to use English lettering to make her products more accessible. “Because of that messaging and because of our active insistence on marketing our products that way [is] why chili crisp has become such a popular condiment in the US. People have realized that it is not any different from Cholula or sriracha, and that it’s nothing to be scared of,” she says.

So in addition to selling directly to customers via the brand’s website, Fly By Jing is now available in more than 400 stores across the country, plus giant grocery retailers like Costco, Whole Foods, Wegmans and Sprouts.

On Reclaiming Her Identity

While Gao’s eventual goal is for Fly By Jing to become a household name like sriracha or Heinz ketchup, the brand’s journey is also deeply tied with her own personal journey of self discovery. “I only just reclaimed my first name Jing this year, after Fly By Jing had already been created,” she says about giving up her westernized moniker, Jenny. “For me, it’s an absolutely personal journey, which is why our tagline on our jars is “Not Traditional, But Personal.” We want it to show that Asian food, Chinese food, Sichuan food: None of it is a monolith.”

Thuma Bed Review: Where Simplicity And Workmanship Cross

ByLindsay Boyers,

Executive Strategy Editor.

I’ve tested hundreds of products, from mattresses to makeup.
Sep 05, 2025, 09:45am EDT

Based in San Francisco, Thuma takes a minimalist approach to its design with a focus on quality craftsmanship. According to the brand, its mindset is to strip away unnecessary fluff to highlight the simplistic beauty of premium furniture that’s built to stand the test of time. This philosophy translates to an appealing design and simple setup process, one that requires less than 10 minutes and no tools. And in addition to ease of setup, each piece of the Thuma Classic Bed Frame feels sturdy, well-crafted and thoughtfully designed. Our Thuma Bed review explores more of the frame’s highlights, possible drawbacks and other frames offered by the brand that are worth considering.

Aside from accommodating almost any mattress, the Classic Bed Frame has a modern, earthy style that seamlessly matches most bedrooms. Two people on the Forbes Vetted team tested the frame in their homes for over a month, and they paid special attention to support, noise, ease of setup and overall quality. For our insights on the bed frame and why it may be so well-received online, continue on below. You can also consider the Thuma Signature Frame, a high-end upholstered choice that has a plusher look and an optional matching headboard.

Thuma Classic Bed Frame

$1,195AND UP

Forbes Vetted

Forbes Vetted ratings are based on thorough evaluations by our editorial team to help you choose the best products with confidence.

4.8

Material: Wood | Trial period: 100 nights | Warranty: Lifetime | Shipping method: Standard or premium | Return policy: Free returns during trial period

Best for:

  • Fans of a clean, minimalist aesthetic
  • Eco-conscious shoppers
  • Sleepers in need of a sturdy, wooden frame
  • Those looking for easy assembly

Skip if:

  • You want more underbed storage
  • You prefer an adjustable bed frame

Thuma Classic Bed Frame Product Features

Easy Assembly That Takes The Pain Out Of Building Furniture

Assembling a bed frame typically requires the effort of two people, one to two hours and a box full of separate parts you must put together using a slightly confusing construction manual. Thuma, however, goes against the grain.

The brand offers two types of delivery: standard or premium. Premium delivery costs $295, but the company sends two representatives to do the handwork for you and remove all the trash. If you choose standard delivery—which is free—setup is simple to do yourself. Kristina Bornholtz, Forbes Vetted senior distribution strategist, says, “It took over an hour to take my old bed frame apart and less than a commercial break to put the Thuma Bed Frame together.” Its design utilizes Japanese joinery that lets you set up the entire bed without tools, as you fit its pieces together like a puzzle. Our other tester echoes, “I couldn’t imagine an easier assembly process, and my hard-to-please husband totally agreed.”

Sustainably Sourced Materials And Multiple Finish Options

Thuma values eco-friendly and sustainable design, and its reflected throughout this frame’s touches. The bulk of the frame is made with 100% upcycled wood that’s available in a walnut, natural, espresso or gray finish. Its slats are lined with what the brand calls “eco fi” felt, which is felt made from recycled plastic, and they lock into place for improved strength. All together, the frame supports up to 1,500 pounds (including your mattress), and one tester claims, “The Thuma bed is the sturdiest frame I’ve ever owned.” She adds, “After a month of sleeping on it, I haven’t felt it budge or wobble once.” She also notes that it’s squeak-free every time she sits or lies on it. Bornholtz concurs with its supportive structure, and adds, “I sleep soundly through the night now and love the look of it in my bedroom.”

You can buy the bed frame alone or bundle it with one of Thuma’s headboard choices: wood, cushioned, wood with cushioning or a pillow board. Just note that the pillow board is the only option that doesn’t physically attach to the frame and the different headboards vary in price, with the headboard and cushion being the most expensive.

Keep A Low Profile With Plenty Of Underbed Space

A low-profile mattress not only looks sleek and modern, but it lets you sleep on a thicker mattress without having to physically jump into bed because it’s too high off the ground. The Thuma Classic Bed Frame sits low, but it still allows nine inches of underbed space in case you like using it for storage. From the ground to the top of the slats, it’s 13 inches tall, while your average bed frame sits around 14 to 17 inches from the ground to the top of the slats.

My Expertise

I am a mattress and sleep editor at Forbes Vetted with a sleep science coach certification. I’ve been writing about and testing products in the sleep space for over six years, and I’ve seen everything from the newest sleep tech to premium, high-end bed frames. In addition to having tested multiple adjustable frames, I’m currently sleeping on the Signature Bed Frame from Thuma. It’s a soft, cushioned frame made from the brand’s performance linen fabric that helped elevate the look of my bedroom, especially when paired with the matching headboard.

Final Thoughts

The Classic Thuma Bed is the brand’s most beloved frame with ads all over Instagram and other social media platforms that showcase its easy setup and premium look. Bornholtz has been sleeping on the Thuma Classic Bed for over a month and is thankful she upgraded. “My old bed frame was a creaky old metal thing, and I got tired of waking myself up when I rolled over in my sleep,” she says. “But the Thuma Classic Bed Frame had everything on my new bed checklist: simple assembly, durable materials and a chic design.”

And according to another tester of ours, “I’ve given a few house tours to friends and family, and so far almost everybody has asked where they can get the same one.” We think the frame is a sound choice for anyone who wants an elevated bedroom look and is willing to invest in a quality pick. It’s also backed by a lifetime warranty, which speaks to its strong construction meant for longevity.

The drawbacks? One of our testers has the pillow board model and doesn’t like that it’s not attached to the frame since it regularly slides around. Although she likes its look, she says she would prefer the wood headboard instead. We also sifted through customer reviews to collect different opinions from those who had a less-than-perfect experience. Most 3-star reviews had to do with the delivery service or complaints about the headboard not being properly secured. That said, the frame has over 19,000 reviews and a 4.9 rating, so most people who sleep on it deem it worth the money (including our editors).

How We Tested The Thuma Bed

We had two different people test the Classic Thuma Bed Frame for over a month in their own bedrooms. During testing, they took note of important metrics like the time and effort required to set up the frame, how sturdy it felt while sleeping, whether or not it made any noise and the overall quality of the bed frame. Each of them set up the bed frame themselves and did not use premium white glove delivery.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

Considering the Classic Bed Frame’s quality wooden construction and lifetime warranty, the frame should last at least 10 years. 

Yes, the Thuma bed is designed to work with any type of mattress. Because the slats are spaced less than three inches apart, it supports memory foam, hybrid and traditional mattresses equally without showing signs of dipping or sagging.
